channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-23509] MapJoin AssertionError: Capacity must be power of 2
item.description:
Observed AssertionError errors in Hive query when rowCount for join is issued as (2^x)+(2^(x+1)).

Following is the stacktrace:

[2020-05-11 05:43:12,135] {base_task_runner.py:95} INFO - Subtask: ERROR : Vertex failed, vertexName=Map 4, vertexId=vertex_1588729523139_51702_1_06, diagnostics=[Task failed, taskId=task_1588729523139_51702_1_06_001286, diagnostics=[TaskAttempt 0 failed, info=[Error: Error while running task ( failure ) : attempt_1588729523139_51702_1_06_001286_0:java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.AssertionError: Capacity must be a power of two [2020-05-11 05:43:12,136] {base_task_runner.py:95} INFO - item.summary: MapJoin AssertionError: Capacity must be power of 2

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: HybridHash got disabled in hive 3.x, due to this and similar issues (MapJoinOperator.reloadHashTable is related to spilling joins locally).

okay; but I think if someone still uses it - or want's to backport it to some older version might make sense to have it
+1
merged into master. Thank you spedamallu for fixing this!
Thank you very much for getting this through!
